history.proof: intros A g P H1 H2. destruct H2 as [a Ha]. shelve.

ctx: intros A g P H1 H2.
exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type g : A -> Prop P : Prop H1 : forall a : A, Marker.group (g a) -> P a : A Ha : g a Unable to unify "g a" with "P".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A : Type) (g : A -> Prop) (P : Prop), (forall a : A, Marker.group (g a) -> P) -> Marker.end_defer (exists a : A, g a) -> P

Premises:
Module Marker := Struct Definition end_defer : Type -> Type. Definition group : Prop -> Prop. Parameter group_fold : forall P : Prop, P -> group P. End 
Marker.group = fun P : Prop => P : Prop -> Prop Arguments Marker.group _%type_scope
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF
Marker.end_defer = fun P : Type => P : Type -> Type Arguments Marker.end_defer _%type_scope
Unnamed_thm : forall (g : Prop) (P : Type), (Marker.group g -> P) -> Marker.end_defer g -> P
VectorDef.Exists_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> SProp), (forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), P x -> P0 (S m) (VectorDef.cons A x m v)) -> (forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), VectorDef.Exists P v -> P0 m v -> P0 (S m) (VectorDef.cons A x m v)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n), VectorDef.Exists P t -> P0 n t
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
Inductive clos_trans_1n (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t1n_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x y | t1n_trans : forall y z : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_trans _%type_scope

Inductive Exists (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> Prop := Exists_cons_hd : forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), P x -> VectorDef.Exists P (VectorDef.cons A x m v) | Exists_cons_tl : forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), VectorDef.Exists P v -> VectorDef.Exists P (VectorDef.cons A x m v) Arguments VectorDef.Exists {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {n}%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.Exists_cons_hd {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {m}%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.Exists_cons_tl {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {m}%nat_scope

ssrbool.and4_rect : forall (P1 P2 P3 P4 : Prop) (P : Type), (P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> P) -> ssrbool.and4 P1 P2 P3 P4 -> P

BinInt.Z.log2_up_double : forall a : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 a -> BinInt.Z.log2_up (BinInt.Z.mul (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) a) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.log2_up a)

Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope

Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (c : C) (lm : list (R * BinNums.positive)), req (Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos rI cI ceqb phi mkpow mkmult_pow c lm) (rmul (phi c) (Ring_polynom.r_list_pow rI rmul lm))

Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (rP : R) (c : C) (lm : list (R * BinNums.positive)), req (Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult rI radd rsub cI ceqb phi get_sign mkpow mkmult_pow rP c lm) (radd rP (rmul (phi c) (Ring_polynom.r_list_pow rI rmul lm)))

Ring_theory.morph_opp : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x))

List.In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
List.rev : forall A : Type, list A -> list A
BinNat.N.mod_small : forall a b : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt a b -> BinNat.N.modulo a b = a

intros A g P H1 H2.
apply H1.
destruct H2 as [a Ha].
apply Ha.
